tasks.task: Design and develop a software system for drone automation in agriculture.
subtasks: Research and understand agricultural needs and challenges.
Experiment with different software systems for drones in farming.
Identify gaps in current technology and ease of use.
Develop a simple and user-friendly drone control app (Skippy Scout).
Implement automated drone flight paths for field coverage.
Utilize AI for image analysis and data interpretation (e.g., crop cover, weed detection, nutrient deficiencies).
Create subscription tiers for different user types (farmers and agronomists) with cost-effective pricing.
Integrate real-time data visualization and accessibility (leaf-level viewing, near real-time image processing).
Expand AI capabilities to recognize various diseases, weeds, and crop growth stages.

tasks.task: Implement AI-driven drone spraying of pesticides or fertilizers.
subtasks: Design algorithms to analyze drone imagery for targeted application zones.
Develop precise drone navigation systems for accurate pesticide/fertilizer delivery.
Integrate drone spraying with automated farm machinery on the ground.

tasks.task: Expand the software system to include intelligent control of drone-based crop management tools.
subtasks: Research and incorporate AI for intelligent crop management decision-making.
Develop software modules for integrated farm management, combining data from drones, soil sensors, etc.
Collaborate with agronomists to refine AI recommendations and multi-sensor data integration.

tasks.task: Achieve widespread adoption and scalability (e.g., 30, 000 users by 2025), contributing to sustainable farming practices.
subtasks: Create marketing and training materials for users at all levels (beginner to expert).
Establish partnerships with agricultural organizations and educational institutions.
Conduct field trials and user testing to refine and validate the technology.
Monitor adoption rates and adjust strategies to meet farmers' evolving needs.
